newsitem.title: USA: US Congress plans hearings on money laundering.
newsitem.headline: US Congress plans hearings on money laundering.

text.p: A House Banking subcommittee will likely hold a series of hearings on money laundering issues, including consideration of recently adopted policies to combat such crimes, the subcommitte's chairman said.
Rep. Spencer Bachus, chairman of the General Oversight and Investigations subcomittee, also praised new rules on foreign bank drafts issued by the Treasury Department Thursday.
The proposal "is an important step in controlling the criminal use of these financial instruments," the Alabama Republican said in a statement.
Bachus said his subcommittee will investigate and probably hold hearings focusing on several specific aspects of money laundering.

The subcommitee will focus on recent law enforcement efforts to cut down on wire transfers with cash remitters in the New York area to Colombia, private banking transactions that can conceal the source or destination of funds and money-laundering via non-bank institutions such as check-cashing stores, Bachus said.
